body.p:
To his Excellecy
B Magoffin
Governor of the Commonwealth
of Kentucky

The undersigned citizens of Oldham County would respectfully represent to your Excellency that at the April Term 1862 of the Oldham Circuit Court, V. Ackerman was fined in the sum of Sixty dollars upon an Indictment charging him with keeping a tipling house, The evidence conduced only to show that nearly twelve months previous to the finding of the Indictment the accused had on two occasions sold wine at his house & received pay for it, We are satisfied from the statements of Mr. Ackerman that he was wholly ignorant of his error. He is the owner of a vineyard and manufactured the wine he sold. He is a foreigner by birth, and wholy unacquanted with the laws of this Country, He is moral & , & honest in all his business transacting. so far as we have ever heard and the coersion of this fine together with two costs would be a severe loss to himself and family, We therefore ask your Excellency to remit the said fine & will ever pray &c

J. W Clayton Cty attorney
S E
W. C. Maithan Cir. Ct. Clk
A I Oldham Co. Clk
T Basye
L A Rodman cty Judge
R A Logan Comth
atto protempere
James

Oldham Cir Ct
$60 } Tipling
V. Ackerman
Issd May 14. 1862
